body_html:
@HossamAmer12 Yup, you can use the C API in a C++ application (I usually end up writing little C++ wrappers to make it easier to use, like scoped wrapper classes).

@pdrews I'm not super familiar with freeze_graph.py but it looks like that should work (the input to TF_ImportGraphDef is a serialized GraphDef proto, which it looks like freeze_graph.py emits).

Also, here's the link to the GPU-enabled version: https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/libtensorflow/libtensorflow-gpu-linux-x86_64-1.0.0.tar.gz

For future reference, these links and some more instructions are inconveniently located here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/go/README.md. I'll look into creating some more documentation for the C API.
